Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the actions of the Algerian hacker by stating that he hacked into 217 banks in Israel to give donations to Palestinians.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove the alleged actions of the hacker.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the photos used in the claim are actually of an Iranian man who was convicted of assassinating a judge in Iran.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photos and information provided are accurate and true without verifying the authenticity.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the claim is based on false information and misleading images, which have been debunked by experts.
